titleInfo.title: Wall Relief of King Horemhab Pouring Libations

mods.abstract: Wall relief of King Horemhab (New Kingdom - Dynasty XVIII) in three quarter view facing right, indentified by cartouches, wears khepresh crown as he pours libations from a vessel made of three long vases; hawk and hieroglyph inscriptions (top); untitled print, "530" in pencil on back of print.

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
